Let Brooksville Country Club become the special place where you begin your lives together. Majestic ancient oak trees draped with Spanish moss grace our beautiful 18-hole golf course – a distinctive and lovely backdrop for your wedding day. Our clubhouse dining rooms feature beautiful views of our golf course. Our elegant facilities are perfect for your traditional, modern, or unconventional wedding. From formal dining to casual buffets, We pride ourself on excellent food and a quality presentation. We have a professional event planner on staff to assist with your special event. You may contact Conrad Hauca at 352-796-8236 or Email him at chauca@brooksvillecc.com

Your event deserves a special venue, and Brooksville Country Club is that special place. Nestled among the majestic oaks, our clubhouse dining rooms feature beautiful views of our golf course. Brooksville Country Club Tee Times - Brooksville FL Log In / Sign Up Hot Deals Courses Near Me Destinations Best Courses Rewards Join GolfPass Gift Cards Search Hot Deals Near Me Off Sort Distance Time Price Golfers Holes Facility Type Reset Filters Featured League Available Brooksville Country Club 23446 Links Drive , Brooksville , Florida , 34601 Holes 18 Par 72 Length 6812 yards Slope 128 Rating 71.5 The most visible amenity of Brooksville Country Club is the championship golf course. The addition of four rock quarry holes, designed by renowned architect Bobby Weed, has set Brooksville Country Club apart from the crowd. The contoured and rolling fairways, dramatic elevation changes, beautifully conditioned course and picturesque back drop creates a breathtaking course and a great challenge.
The par-72, 18-hole course features four tee boxes to challenge every level of golfer. It stretches for 6,812 yards from the farthest tees, and it has a slope rating of 128 and a course rating of 72.9 Read More... Directions Course Details Review Mobile Check-In Skip the line and check in for your tee time directly in the GolfNow app. Learn More Leagues Available Social golf leagues available at this course Join Now Powered by Spark Golf We partnered up with Spark Golf to bring you social, competitive 9-hole leagues at your favorite courses. Each round has a 2-person team & individual game with end of league champs. Compete in a laid-back atmosphere over 9-holes Play with friends and meet like-minded new ones. Overnight Day And Summer Camp At The Brooksville Country Club - American Collegiate Academy - Brooksville Country Club Skip to content About About The Club Accolades Gallery Our Team Play Golf The Course Tee Times Scorecard Course Rates Golf Lessons Youth on Course Golf Tournaments Membership Membership Plans Membership Application Member Login Facilities Majestic Oaks Restaurant Menu Fitness Facility Pickleball Court Special Events Weddings and Banquets Golf Tournaments Pickleball Events Pickleball Coaching Bar & Restaurant Summer Camp 2025 Contact Us About About The Club Accolades Gallery Our Team Play Golf The Course Tee Times Scorecard Course Rates Golf Lessons Youth on Course Golf Tournaments Membership Membership Plans Membership Application Member Login Facilities Majestic Oaks Restaurant Menu Fitness Facility Pickleball Court Special Events Weddings and Banquets Golf Tournaments Pickleball Events Pickleball Coaching Bar & Restaurant Summer Camp 2025 Contact Us Book a Tee Time Brooksville Country Club K-12 Camp in Brooksville, Florida Brooksville Country Club Youth Summer Camp Program Choose a camp that is right for you Sign Up Now American Collegiate Academy the owner of the Brooksville Country Club has been approved by the city of Brooksville to open a K-12 school for 1200 students with dorm rooms for 150 students focused on high-level academics and top level sports along side the Brooksville Country Club. (please note the Country Club will continue to operate alongside the school). In preparation of the school opening, Brooksville Country Club will offer a 5 and 9 day stem plus sports camps with day and overnight options in cooperation with the Chinsegut Hill Retreat. Contact Tom Shea with any additional questions. Phone: 813-728-4466 Email: tshea@brooksvillecc.com 5 Day Camp Schedule: June 17th - 21st Day 1 Day 2 Day 3 Day 4 Day 5 Day 1 ARRIVAL Arrive 1 pm. Tour the Brooksville Country Club facility, followed by a meeting with the staff. Conduct a swim test at Brooksville Country Club for summer campers; non-swimmers will wear life jackets and receive lessons with out life jackets during swim time, while swimmers can enjoy supervised swim time. 5:30 PM: Pick up for Day Campers 5:00 to 6:00 PM: Dinner at Brooksville Country Club for Overnight Campers. 6:30 PM: Check into cabins at Chinsegut Hill Retreat, a historic retreat managed by Brooksville City and built by the University of South Florida for Overnight Campers. Sign Up Now Day 2 Full Activity Day Breakfast at Chinsegut Hill Retreat for Overnight Campers. 8:30 AM: Drop off for Day Campers. 9:00 AM to 10:00 AM: Stem activity for Day Campers 9:40 AM: Drive ten minutes to Brooksville Country Club for Overnight Campers. 10:00 AM to 12:00 PM: Introduction to golf with golf pro Tom Shea for all Campers. 12:00 to 1:00 PM: Lunch at Brooksville Country Club for all Campers. 1:00 to 2:00 PM: Pickleball Lessons for all Campers 2:00 to 4:00 PM: Swimming at the Country Club for all Campers. 4:00 to 6:00 PM: Out to Nature with Florida A&M University for a STEM Class in Chinsegut Wildlife and Environmental Area for all Campers. 6:00 PM: Pick up for Day Campers 6:00 to 7:00 PM: Dinner at Brooksville Country Club for Overnight Campers. 7:00 PM: Drive ten minutes back to Chinsegut Hill Retreat for Overnight Campers. Sign Up Now Day 3 Sports and Activity Day Breakfast at Chinsegut Hill Retreat for Overnight Campers. 7:45 AM: Drive to Brooksville Country Club for Overnight Campers. 8:00 AM to 8:30 AM: Drop off for Day Campers. 8:00 to 10:00 AM: Pickleball lessons at Brooksville Country Club for all Campers. 10:00 AM to 12:00 PM: STEM with Tom Shea for all Campers. 1:00 to 2:00 PM: Lunch at Brooksville Country Club for all Campers. 1:00 to 5:00 PM: Crystal River tour to see incredible wildlife for all Campers. Stem class. 5:30 PM: Pick up at Brooksville Country Club for Day Campers. 6:00 to 7:00 PM: Barbecue at Chinsegut Hill Retreat for Overnight Campers and bonfire. Sign Up Now Day 4 Water and Mermaid Adventure Breakfast at lodging for Overnight Campers. 8:30 AM: Drop off for Day Campers. 9:00 AM to 5:00 PM: Visit Buccaneers Bay Water Park, the focal point of the Netflix documentary "Merpeople." Enjoy the live mermaid show, water slides, and swimming at the crystal-clear Weeki Wachee River (lunch - bagged lunch) for all Campers. 5:30 PM: Pick up for Day Campers. Dinner at Brooksville Country Club for Overnight Campers. Sign Up Now Day 5 Sports and Activity Day Breakfast at Chinsegut Hill Retreat for Overnight Campers. 8:30 PM: Drop off for Day Campers. 9:00 to 11:00 AM: STEM program at Chinsegut Wildlife and Environmental Area with Florida Fish and Wildlife staff, where kids will learn to track animals and do archery for all Campers. 12:00 to 1:00 PM: Lunch at Brooksville Country Club for all Campers. 1:00 to 2:00 PM: Golf Lessons for all Campers. 2:00 to 4:00 PM: Swimming at Brooksville Country Club for all Campers. 4:00 to 6:00 PM: Pickleball lesson with pickleball pro for all Campers. 5:30 PM to 6:00 PM: Pick up for Day Campers. 6:00 to 7:00 PM: Dinner at Brooksville Country Club for Overnight Campers. 7:30 PM: Return to Chinsegut Hill Retreat for Overnight Campers. Tour the Brooksville Country Club facility, followed by a meeting with the staff. Conduct a swim test at Brooksville Country Club for summer campers; non-swimmers will wear life jackets and receive lessons with out life jackets during swim time, while swimmers can enjoy supervised swim time. 5:30 PM: Pick up for Day Campers 5:00 to 6:00 PM: Dinner at Brooksville Country Club for Overnight Campers. 6:30 PM: Check into cabins at Chinsegut Hill Retreat, a historic retreat managed by Brooksville City and built by the University of South Florida for Overnight Campers. Sign Up Now Day 5 Sports and Activity Day Breakfast at Chinsegut Hill Retreat for Overnight Campers. 8:30 PM: Drop off for Day Campers. 9:00 to 11:00 AM: STEM program at Chinsegut Wildlife and Environmental Area with Florida Fish and Wildlife staff, where kids will learn to track animals and do archery for all Campers. 12:00 to 1:00 PM: Lunch at Brooksville Country Club for all Campers. 1:00 to 2:00 PM: Golf Lessons for all Campers. 2:00 to 4:00 PM: Swimming at Brooksville Country Club for all Campers. 4:00 to 6:00 PM: Pickleball lesson with pickleball pro for all Campers. 5:30 PM to 6:00 PM: Pick up for Day Campers. 6:00 to 7:00 PM: Dinner at Brooksville Country Club for Overnight Campers. 7:30 PM: Return to Chinsegut Hill Retreat for Overnight Campers. Sign Up Now Day 6 Travel Day Breakfast at lodging for Overnight Campers. 8:30 AM: Drop off for Day Campers. 9:00 AM to 1:00 PM: Visit the University of South Florida, explore the campus, and attend a STEM class on nature conservation for all Campers. 1:00 to 2:00 PM: Lunch at McDonald's for all Campers. 2:00 to 5:00 PM: Tampa Bay Tour, visiting downtown and the University of South Florida for all Campers. 6:00 PM: Pick up for Day Campers. 6:00 to 7:00 PM: Dinner at Brooksville Country Club for Overnight Campers. 7:30 PM: Return to Chinsegut Hill Retreat for Overnight Campers. Sign Up Now Day 7 Activity Day at Brooksville Country Club Breakfast at Chinsegut Hilltop Retreat for Overnight Campers. 8:30 AM: Drop off for Day Campers. 9:00 AM to 10:00 AM: Pickleball for Day Campers. 10:00 AM to 12:00 PM: Golf lessons at Brooksville Country Club for all Campers. 12:00 to 1:00 PM: Lunch at Brooksville Country Club for all Campers. 1:00 to 2:00 PM: Pickleball for all Campers. 2:00 to 4:00 PM: Swimming at Brooksville Country Club for all Campers: 4:00 to 6:00 PM: STEM with Tom Shea for all Campers. 6:00 to 9:00: Pick up for Day School Campers. 6:00 to 9:00 PM: Barbecue, outdoor movie at the pool, and Swimming at Brooksville Country Club for all Campers. 8:30 PM: Return to Chinsegut Hilltop Retreat for Overnight Campers. Sign Up Now Day 8 Clearwater Beach and ACA School Breakfast at Chinsegut Hilltop Retreat for Overnight Campers. 8:30 AM: Drop off Day Campers. 9:00 AM to 5:00 PM: Visit American Collegiate Academy (ACA) school, Clearwater Beach, the boardwalk, and take a boat on the intercoastal and Gulf to see Dolphins in their natural habitat and other wildlife or visit the Clearwater Marine Aquarium (depending on availability) for all Campers. 6:00 PM: Pick Up Day Campers. 6:00 PM: Dinner at Brooksville Country Club for Overnight Campers. Sign Up Now Day 9 Awards and Goodbyes Breakfast at Chinsegut Hilltop Retreat for Overnight Campers. 8:30 to 10:00 AM: Golf tournament all Campers 10:00 AM to 2:00 PM: Swimming, barbecue, and games with staff. 2:00 to 4:00 PM: Pickleball tournament all Campers. 4:00 to 5:00 PM: Certificate and awards ceremony for golf, pickleball, STEM,  at Brooksville Country Club. 5:30 PM: All Campers pick up. Sign Up Now Travel and Adventure in World-Famous Florida (international) 13 Day Camp (INTERNATIONAL): June 17th - 29th Day 1 Day 2 Day 3 Day 4 Day 5 Day 6 Day 7 Day 8 Day 9 Day 10 Day 11 Day 12 Day 13 Day 1 ARRIVAL Pick up at Orlando Airport, then drive to Brooksville Country Club, a renowned golf and country club in central Florida. Enjoy lunch either on the road or at Brooksville Country Club. Tour the Brooksville Country Club facility, followed by a meeting with the staff. Conduct a swim test at Brooksville Country Club for summer campers; non-swimmers will wear life jackets and receive lessons with out life jackets during swim time, while swimmers can enjoy supervised swim time. 5:00 to 6:00 PM: Dinner at Brooksville Country Club. 6:30 PM: Check into cabins at Chinsegut Hill Retreat, a historic retreat managed by Brooksville City and built by the University of South Florida. Sign Up Now Day 2 Full Activity Day Breakfast at Chinsegut Hill Retreat. 9:40 AM: Drive ten minutes to Brooksville Country Club. 10:00 AM to 12:00 PM: Introduction to golf with golf pro Tom Shea. 12:00 to 1:00 PM: Lunch at Brooksville Country Club. 1:00 to 2:00 PM: English Lesson at the Country Club. 2:00 to 4:00 PM: Swimming at the Country Club. 4:00 to 6:00 PM: Out to Nature with Florida A&M University for a STEM Class in Chinsegut Wildlife and Environmental Area. 6:00 to 7:00 PM: Dinner at Brooksville Country Club. 7:00 PM: Drive ten minutes back to Chinsegut Hill Retreat. Sign Up Now Day 3 Sports and Activity Day Breakfast at Chinsegut Hill Retreat. 7:45 AM: Drive to Brooksville Country Club. 8:00 to 10:00 AM: Pickleball lessons at Brooksville Country Club. 10:00 AM to 12:00 PM: STEM with Tom Shea. 1:00 to 2:00 PM: Lunch at Brooksville Country Club. 1:00 to 5:00 PM: Crystal River tour to see incredible wildlife. Stem class. 6:00 to 7:00 PM: Barbecue at Chinsegut Hill Retreat and bonfire. Sign Up Now Day 4 Water and Mermaid Adventure Breakfast at lodging. 9:00 AM to 5:00 PM: Visit Buccaneers Bay Water Park, the focal point of the Netflix documentary "Merpeople." Enjoy the live mermaid show, water slides, and swimming at the crystal-clear Weeki Wachee River (lunch - bagged lunch). Dinner at Brooksville Country Club. Sign Up Now Day 5 Sports and Activity Day Breakfast at Chinsegut Hill Retreat. 9:00 to 11:00 AM: STEM program at Chinsegut Wildlife and Environmental Area with Florida Fish and Wildlife staff, where kids will learn to track animals and do archery. 12:00 to 1:00 PM: Lunch at Brooksville Country Club. 1:00 to 2:00 PM: English Lesson in the classroom at Brooksville Country Club. 2:00 to 4:00 PM: Swimming at Brooksville Country Club. 4:00 to 6:00 PM: Pickleball lesson with pickleball pro Igor. 6:00 to 7:00 PM: Dinner at Brooksville Country Club. 7:30 PM: Return to Chinsegut Hill Retreat. Sign Up Now Day 6 Travel Day Breakfast at lodging. 9:00 AM to 1:00 PM: Visit the University of South Florida, explore the campus, and attend a STEM class on nature conservation. 1:00 to 2:00 PM: Lunch at McDonald's. 2:00 to 5:00 PM: Tampa Bay Tour, visiting downtown and the University of South Florida. 6:00 to 7:00 PM: Dinner at Brooksville Country Club. 7:30 PM: Return to Chinsegut Hill Retreat. Sign Up Now Day 7 Activity Day at Brooksville Country Club Breakfast at Chinsegut Hilltop Retreat. 10:00 AM to 12:00 PM: Golf lessons at Brooksville Country Club. 12:00 to 1:00 PM: Lunch at Brooksville Country Club. 1:00 to 2:00 PM: English Lesson. 2:00 to 4:00 PM: Swimming at Brooksville Country Club. 4:00 to 6:00 PM: STEM with Tom Shea. 6:00 to 9:00 PM: Barbecue, outdoor movie at the pool, and Swimming at Brooksville Country Club. 8:30 PM: Return to Chinsegut Hilltop Retreat. Sign Up Now Day 8 Clearwater Beach and ACA School Breakfast at Chinsegut Hilltop Retreat. 9:00 AM to 5:00 PM: Visit American Collegiate Academy (ACA) school, Clearwater Beach, the boardwalk, and take a boat on the intercoastal and Gulf to see Dolphins in their natural habitat and other wildlife or visit the Clearwater Aquarium (depending on availability). 6:00 PM: Dinner at Brooksville Country Club. Sign Up Now Day 9 Awards and Goodbyes Breakfast at Chinsegut Hilltop Retreat. 8:00 to 10:00 AM: Visit the Florida Mermaid Trail, a unique walking tour showcasing the cultural history and natural beauty of downtown Brooksville. 10:00 AM to 2:00 PM: Swimming, barbecue, and games with staff. 2:00 to 4:00 PM: Wrap up English and STEM sessions. 4:00 to 5:00 PM: Certificate and awards ceremony for golf, pickleball, STEM, and English at Brooksville Country Club. 5:00 to 6:30 PM: Goodbye dinner at Brooksville Country Club. Sign Up Now Day 10 TRAVEL Breakfast at lodging. 8:00 AM to 2:00 PM: Tour Gainesville and the University of Florida, visit the campus, and attend a STEM class. Lunch in Gainesville. 2:00 to 4:00 PM: Travel to Orlando. 4:00 to 8:00 PM: Outlet shopping in Orlando Premium Outlets. Dinner at the outlet. Sign Up Now Day 11 Disney Epcot Center Breakfast at lodging. 9:00 AM to 6:00 PM: Disney Epcot Center. 6:00 to 7:00 PM: Dinner. Sign Up Now Day 12 Apopka Wildlife Park 7:00 AM to 12:00 PM: Visit Lake Apopka Wildlife Drive to see alligators and other wildlife in their natural habitat. Lunch on the road. 1:00 to 5:00 PM: Disney Springs. Sign Up Now Day 13 Flight and Travel 5:30 PM: All Campers pick up. Camp Collegiate 4 weeks (Clearwater) ACA Camp Collegiate + Transportation 4 weeks (Clearwater) Total Brooksville Country Club K-12 Camp in Brooksville, Florida OVERNIGHT and DAYtime SUMMER CAMP for k-12 BCC invites kids to an exciting summer camp with both daytime and overnight options. Explore a world of adventure with golf and pickleball lessons, and a STEM class held in the scenic Chinsegut Wildlife and Environmental Area. Adventure awaits with exciting field trips to Crystal River, Buccaneer Bay, and the famous Weeki Wachee Springs. Join us for a summer filled with fun, learning, and unforgettable memories! This is a golf course community , and also includes a country club, community pool and a pro shop for all your golfing needs. Homes in this development range in square footage from around 1,418 square feet to over 3,283 square feet with 1 and 2 car garages. Located in Hernando County , you are just a few miles away from Ridge Manor Community Park, Withlacoochee State Trail and I-75. These adorable homes are perfect for families who enjoy nature walks, biking, golfing, or fishing. Sherman Hills would be a wonderful place to call home.
